column4: Just install Ubuntu to the USB drive the same way you would to an internal drive.
and Fyodorovna: Is there anything special I need to do to make the USB bootable?   Can I use grub to make it multiboot on the USB?
What OSs do you want to install to this USB drive other than Ubuntu?

You should be able to install Backtrack as if to an internal drive, though you'd have to confirm that in their support channel. I already said that you can simply use Ubuntu's installer and install to the USB drive the same way you would an internal drive. After you do that it will be bootable.
